text:
Gas (Pipeline Corridor) Hobart Order 2014

I make the following order under section 79E of the Gas Act 2000 .

14 October 2014

MATTHEW GROOM

Minister for Energy

1. Short title
    This order may be cited as the Gas (Pipeline Corridor) Hobart Order 2014 .

2. Commencement
    This order takes effect on the day on which its making is notified in the Gazette.

3. Interpretation
    In this order –
        Act means the Gas Act 2000 .

4. Planning corridor
        (1) In this clause –
            pipeline sections means the sections of pipeline that –
                    (a) are part of the pipeline referred to in the licence, granted under section 24 of the Act to Tas Gas Networks Pty Ltd on 14 July 2003, as amended; and
                    (b) extend from –
                            (i) the point situated at 521,912.6E and 5,257,571.3N and terminate at –
                                    (a) the point situated at 525,050.0E and 5,258,004.8N; and
                                    (b) the point situated at 524,900.2E and 5,258,227.6N; and
                                    (c) the point situated at 525,514.7E and 5,258,099.9N; and
                            (ii) the Clare Street District Regulator Station situated at 524,700.6E and 5,254,258.7N, and terminate at –
                                    (a) the point situated at 527,239.6E and 5,252,449.5N; and
                                    (b) the point situated at 527,484.9E and 5,249,850.6N; and
                                    (c) the point situated at 526,837.5E and 5,249,550.6N; and
                    (c) are each shown bounded by a heavy, black, broken line on Plan 9752 in the Central Plan Register, a reduced copy of which is set out, by way of illustration only, in Schedule 1 to this order.
        (2) A planning corridor is declared in respect of the pipeline sections.
        (3) The planning corridor declared in respect of the pipeline sections –
                (a) extends along the length of the pipeline sections and is 25 metres wide on each side of the pipeline sections; and
                (b) extends away from each end of the pipeline sections in a semicircle with a radius of 25 metres from the centre-line at that end of the pipeline section.
        (4) For the purposes of subclause (3)(a) of this clause, the width of each side of the planning corridor in respect of the pipeline sections is measured –
                (a) from the centre-line of the pipeline sections; and
                (b) at a right angle from the centre-line of the pipeline sections.

SCHEDULE 1 - Plan

Clause 4

Displayed and numbered in accordance with the Rules Publication Act 1953.

Notified in the Gazette on 22 October 2014

This order is administered in the Department of State Growth.
